Welcome to DHSpy’s documentation!¶

DHSpy Base¶

Init file which generates the query module.

DHSpy.__init__.get_docs()[source]¶

Open package documentation in new browser

class DHSpy.__init__.query[source]¶
Attr series_selection:
 the series codes to download via the API. To search for series codes, use the find_series_codes() method.
Attr country_selection:
 two-letter country codes of interest. To search for series codes, use the find_country_codes() method.
Attr survey_selection:
 list of survey codes to download. To search for survey codes, use the find_survey_codes() method.
Attr series_options:
 dataframe of all series options in the DHS database.
Attr country_options:
 dataframe of all country options in the DHS database.
Attr survey_options:
 dataframe of all survey options in the DHS database.
find_country_codes(country_names: list)[source]¶

The find country codes of interest given a country name or list of country names

Parameters:country_names (list) – list of country names of interest
return
pandas.DataFrame()
get_DHS_metadata(columns_interest=['IndicatorId', 'Label', 'Definition'])[source]¶

This function creates a pandas dataframe of the metadata selected in metadata_type.

Parameters:
  • metadata_type (str) – the metadata of interest, known options = {‘indicators’, ‘countries’, ‘surveys’}.
  • columns_interest (list) – columns to return in the dataframe, pass ‘all’ for all columns available. Default: [‘IndicatorId’, ‘Label’, ‘Definition’].
return
pandas dataframe of metadata
run()[source]¶

Run the query given the series and survey selection.
